New Records: Sunil Chhetri played his 151st and last match for India.
Key Match Events: Gurpreet Singh Sandhu made a vital save early on against Mohammad Abdulah.
Anwar Ali's header from an Anirudh Thapa corner went inches over the bar.
Eid Alrashidi broke the offside trap but missed the goal.
Jay Gupta's low cross was cleared by Hasan Alanezi.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu made a stunning reflex save from Faisal Alharbi's volley.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu stretched to push out Yousef Alsulaiman's effort.
Sulaiman Abdulghafoor made a one-on-one save against Rahim Ali.
Rahul Bheke blocked Ali Matar's shot.
Brandon Fernandes' low ball was cleared by Alenezi.
Chhangte's cross to Manvir was nodded wide.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams observed a minute's silence in memory of Anil Kamat.
Post-Match Reflections: Sunil Chhetri bid farewell to international football with an emotional lap around the stadium.
Indian players and team officials gave Chhetri a guard of honour.
Kuwait's players and officials paid their respects to Chhetri with handshakes and hugs.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu was named the player of the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's hopes for qualifying for the third round of the FIFA World Cup 2026 and AFC Asian Cup 2027 Preliminary Joint Qualification took a hit with the draw.
India remains in second place with five points, while Kuwait stays alive with four points.
India will hope for Qatar's victory over Afghanistan and a draw between Kuwait and Afghanistan on June 11.
Others: Igor Stimac handed out a full India debut to left-back Jay Gupta.
Edmund Lalrindika made his debut, replacing Jay Gupta in the last seven minutes.
